This vignette walks through the core pipeline: fetch URLs, read content, process with `textpress`, and search.

## Fetch and read

```{r, eval = FALSE}
library(textpress)

# Wikipedia articles
wiki_urls <- textpress::fetch_wiki_urls("American Generations", limit = 5)
corpus <- textpress::read_urls(wiki_urls[1:3], exclude_wiki_refs = TRUE)
```

## Process and search

```{r, eval = FALSE}
# Add doc_id and split into sentences
corpus$doc_id <- seq_len(nrow(corpus))
sentences <- textpress::nlp_split_sentences(corpus, by = c("url", "node_id"))

# Dictionary match (e.g. generation terms)
hits <- textpress::search_dict(sentences, by = c("doc_id", "sentence_id"),
                               terms = textpress::dict_generations$variant)
```

See the [API map](https://jaytimm.github.io/textpress/) for the full Fetch, Read, Process, Search reference.
